sentences.english: Time is not on our side. We need to keep moving forward and we need to move fast.

sentences.english: The rapid development of the present vocational colleges calls for the 2nd-level management in schools or departments.

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the 1911 Revolution.

sentences.english: Some investors even raked in up to 40 percent in profits.

sentences.english: How quickly their shrieks of pain turn to enraptured adulation.

So, in order to move fast, we have to stand on giants' shoulders.

sentences.english: The additional troops quickly divided the North Korean forces, which had been stretched from north to south.

definition: and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
in the first moments (of sth happening)/immediately (after an event)/first thing
as quickly as possible/as soon as possible/with all speed
